segments.en: Linked Discourses 35
15. The Old and the New
146. The Cessation of Action

segments.pli: “Navapurāṇāni, bhikkhave, kammāni desessāmi kammanirodhaṃ kammanirodhagāminiñca paṭipadaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you old action, new action, the cessation of action, and the practice that leads to the cessation of action.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmīti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak. …
And what is old action?

segments.pli: Cakkhu, bhikkhave, purāṇakammaṃ abhisaṅkhataṃ abhisañcetayitaṃ vedaniyaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ … pe …
segments.en: The eye is old action. It should be seen as produced by choices and intentions, as something to be felt.

segments.pli: jivhā purāṇakammā abhisaṅkhatā abhisañcetayitā vedaniyā daṭṭhabbā … pe …
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: mano purāṇakammo abhisaṅkhato abhisañcetayito vedaniyo daṭṭhabbo.
segments.en: mind is old action. It should be seen as produced by choices and intentions, as something to be felt.
This is called old action.
And what is new action?

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, etarahi kammaṃ karoti kāyena vācāya manasā,
segments.en: The deeds you currently perform by way of body, speech, and mind.
This is called new action.
And what is the cessation of action?

segments.pli: Yo kho, bhikkhave, kāyakammavacīkammamanokammassa nirodhā vimuttiṃ phusati,
segments.en: When you experience freedom due to the cessation of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
This is called the cessation of action.
And what’s the practice that leads to the cessation of action?
It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

segments.pli: sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi—
segments.en: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
This is called the practice that leads to the cessation of action.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ mayā purāṇakammaṃ, desitaṃ navakammaṃ, desito kammanirodho, desitā kammanirodhagāminī paṭipadā.
segments.en: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you old action, new action, the cessation of action, and the practice that leads to the cessation of action.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
segments.en: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

segments.pli: Etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādattha; mā pacchāvippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī”ti.
segments.en: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, I will teach you old action, new action,…

suttaplex.blurb: The six interior sense fields are not yours, but are old kamma, generated by choices in past lives. This is explained in terms of the four noble truths.
